properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 6:46PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
At 646 PM CST, strong thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 4 miles west of Lake Wister State Park to 9 miles east
of Talimena State Park to 3 miles southeast of Whitesboro. Movement
was northeast at 50 mph.

Winds in excess of 40 mph will be possible with these storms.

Locations in or near the path include...
Fort Smith...                     Poteau...
Greenwood...                      Pocola...
Heavener...                       Arkoma...
Wister...                         Hackett...
Howe...                           Hartford...
Bonanza...                        Fanshawe...
Midland...                        Cameron...
Heavener Runestone State Park...  Excelsior...
Lake Wister State Park...         Muse...
Jenny Lind...                     Shady Point...

This includes Interstate 540 between mile markers 11 and 14.
properties.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWESTERN SEBASTIAN AND EASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES UNTIL 730 PM CST
